docs.lead_paragraph: An emerging breed of individual Japanese investors is starting to break from the traditionally docile ranks of shareholders and hold company managers accountable on a range of issues.

headline.main: Japanese Shareholders Starting to Show Their Teeth
headline.print_headline: In a Shift, Japanese Shareholders Take a Stand

docs.abstract: Emerging breed of individual Japanese investors is starting to break from the traditionally docile ranks of shareholders and hold company managers accountable on a range of issues; individual investors still hold little power compared with the institutional shareholders that make up much of the investor base.
docs.snippet: An emerging breed of individual Japanese investors is starting to break from the traditionally docile ranks of shareholders and hold company managers accountable on a range of issues.

headline.main: No Matter What Court Decides, Health Care Law Has 'Got to Go,' Romney Says

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney said that whether or not the Supreme Court deems the government's health care plan constitutional, "we already know it's bad policy."

headline.main: Overconfidence Suggested in Supreme Court Predictions

docs.abstract: The odds of the individual mandate being overturned have fluctuated some since oral arguments in March, but have risen even further in the past few weeks.
